question: A Brown precipitate (A) dissolve in HNO<sub>3</sub>, gives (B) which gives white ppt (C) with NH<sub>4</sub>OH. (C) on reaction with HCl gives solution (D), which gives white turbidity on addition of water. What is the turbidity?
The compound which does not respond to brown ring test
solution: A common nitrate test, known as the brown ring test can be performed by adding iron sulphate to a solution of nitrate, then slowly adding concentrated sulphuric acid such that the acid forms a layer below the aqueous solution. When lead nitrate reacts with FeSO4 to form PbSO4 precipitate.

question:
A mixture contains Cu2+, Al3+ and Ni2+. Following steps have been adopted for separation but written in disorder.
           I. Filter, boil off H2S gas and NH4Cl, heat and add NH4OH
           II. Filter, add NH4OH and pass H2S gas
           III. Pass H2S gas into acidified solution of mixture
Steps will be used in the following order
solution:
1. Passing H2S in acid medium precipitate CuS but not Al3+ and Ni2+.
2. Addition of NH4Cl and NH4OH now precipitate Al(OH)3 but not Ni2+.
Ni2+ is precipitated as NiS in alkaline medium.

question: A white powder when strongly heated gives off brown fumes. A solution of this powder gives a yellow precipitate with KI. When a solution of barium chloride is added to a solution of powder, a white precipitate results. This white powder may be
Among PbS, CuS, HgS, MnS, CoS, Bi<sub>2</sub>S<sub>3</sub> , SnS<sub>2</sub> How many ore black in colour?
solution: PbS, CuS, HgS, Ag2S, NiS and CoS are black coloured. Therefore answer is five.

question: Which of the following colour was wrongly mentioned?
op3: Aqueous ferric chloride is brown colour
op4: Both PbCl<sub>2</sub> and AgCl are white precipitates
solution: Anhydrous Na2CO3 is colourless, whereas Hydrated Na2CO3 is brown colour.

question: M is a cation which exists as a nitrate compound in an aqueous solution. Part of this solution is separated and H<sub>2</sub>S gas is sent. Then a black precipitate is given. Next, another part of this M's nitrate solution is separated. When NaOH is added, white precipitate is given. With excess NaOH, white precipitate dissolve and give colourless solution. What could be the cation?
solution: Lead Nitrate exists as aqueous solution, Lead nitrate when reacted with H2S gas gives black precipitate of PbS and when reacted with Na(OH) gives white precipitate of Pb(OH)2. Therefore cation is Pb2+.

Find the compound which undergoes nucleophilic substitution reaction exclusively by an SN1 mechanism
solution: Generally alpha benzyl undergo nucleophilic SN1 reaction. Therefore as Benzyl chloride is apha benzyl it undergoes SN1 reaction.
